isis.stitle: ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION

svcsubsecinfo.para: This section describes the electrical operation of the International circuits and components used to connect the transmission to the vehicle electrical system and to the various International-installed controls.

The operation description makes reference to connector and wire numbers in describing the system. For the purpose of the description, references will be from the circuit diagrams for the 2000, 4000, 8000 models.The other models included in this section--the 3600, 3800 and 3900FC--operate in the same manner, but harness configuration is different and some connector and circuit numbers are different.

note.para: Refer to the Circuit Diagrams for the 2000, 4000 and 8000 models located in this service manual section for the following discussions.

svcproc.title: WT ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM POWER SOURCE
svcproc.para: The WT electronic control system receives battery power at all times and ignition power when the key is ON.

BATTERY POWER - Direct battery power from the B+ terminal of the cranking motor solenoid is delivered (circuit 329) to the Main Power fuse located in the Vehicle Interface Module (VIM). Power from the Main Power fuse is present at all times to the ECU, the Data Link Connector (419) and the shift selector (420).
IGNITION POWER - With the key ON, ignition power from the key switch (63) is delivered (circuit 13J/A303/303) to the ignition (IGN) power fuse, located in the VIM.
The ignition voltage acts as an ON/OFF switch for the WT ECU and provides ignition power to selected relays located in the VIM.
